comments: Hello Ron,    
 
 My name is Salim, and I will assist you with your Case. I would like to confirm the following is correct for the issue you are currently facing:  
 
Issue:     
You'd like to update 'FSM Configurable Dispatcher Workspace' on your prod instance however you're unable to due to the all applications page loading. 
 
Investigation Summary:     
Thank you for reaching out to us. 
 
I can see version 23.2.3 of 'FSM Configurable Dispatcher Workspace' is compatible with the Tokyo release and your instances are in the compatible release. I understand you're able to download this version from the store without issues. 
 
Next Steps:    
Can you kindly share screenshots of the 'Plugins' page and also confirm how long this page has been 'loading' for? 
Are also experiencing this issue on multiple browsers? 
 
I look forward to your response. 
 
*** 
 
As part of the troubleshooting process, I and other ServiceNow personnel may need to access your instance(s) in order to review the service impact to your instance and determine the root cause. It may also be necessary to make some changes on a sub-production instance in order to troubleshoot the issue or to test a probable solution. These changes, if any, will be reverted back to the original state. If any change is not reverted a reason will be provided for the same. 
 
If you need immediate assistance, please use one of the contact numbers from our support contact page: 
http://www.servicenow.com/support/contact-support.html You will then be able to enter your Case or Change number over the phone to have your call routed to the Support Team.  
 
Best regards, 
Salim

Could you kindly confirm if the 'sn_appclient.app.install.offline' is set to true on the instance as per the steps on the below Knowledge article?

Salim

From: HR Agent <HR Agent.HR XXXXXXservicenow.com> Sent: Thursday, January 26, 2023 8:35 AMTo: Robin Wilson <XXXXXXXXXXXXXservicenow.com>Subject: Parental Leave Policy
 
Hi Robin,
I hope you are doing well!
As per the ServiceNow policy and the KB0048146 : Parental leave process - EMEA knowledge article, it confirms:
Eligibility
The ServiceNow Paid Parental Leave applies to all regular ServiceNow employees who are actively employed and have not given or received notice of termination and are welcoming a child into their home, either through birth, adoption, foster placement, or surrogacy while employed at ServiceNow.
From this, my understanding is that if the baby is born before joining ServiceNow, they would not be entitled to the ServiceNow parental leave.
That being said, the new hire (Jakob Froehner (33919) joining on 01/02/2023) informed the manager his baby was due end of February 2023 and planned to take parental leave throughout the year, however his baby was born 5 weeks early (2 days ago) so I wanted to check to see if there was any potential for an exception here?
Thanks!
HR Agent
Advisor, People Care - EMEA

comments: 
Hi Marko, 

I hope you are doing well!

As per the ServiceNow policy and the KB0048146 : Parental leave process - EMEA knowledge article, it confirms:

Eligibility 
The ServiceNow Paid Parental Leave applies to all regular ServiceNow employees who are actively employed and have not given or received notice of termination and are welcoming a child into their home, either through birth, adoption, foster placement, or surrogacy while employed at ServiceNow. 

From this, if the baby is born before joining ServiceNow, they would not be entitled to the ServiceNow parental leave. That being said, I have reached out to the time off team for further guidance if there is any potential for an exception with a baby born early.

Thanks! 
HR Agent


work_notes: 
Attachment Added. File name: blob by user:HR Agent


comments: 
Hi John, 

You are welcome!  Following my previous comment, I received confirmation from the time off team that as per the ServiceNow policy as outlines in the KB0048146 : Parental leave process - EMEA knowledge article, the ServiceNow Paid Parental Leave applies to all regular ServiceNow employees who are actively employed and have not given or received notice of termination and are welcoming a child into their home, either through birth, adoption, foster placement, or surrogacy while employed at ServiceNow.

That being said, unfortunately there are no exceptions to this Global Policy which means Jakob will not be eligible to the parental leave. I appreciate this will not be the answer Jakob will be hoping for, however this is a Global policy which is in place to ensure a fair and consistent approach for all employees. 

I will now close out your case but please feel free to reopen and let me know if you require any further support.
 
Have a great rest of your day!
HR Agent 
 
Please note, you will receive a survey to complete regarding your HR Case experience with the Global Talent team and would be grateful if you could provide your feedback. Thank you in advance for your time!

work_notes: CSTASK628596 (Global Security Support Center) Task notes  updated by felipe.tavaresdesa

[INTERNAL] 
Hi @Mahesh Kumar Sanga (NOW), please have the customer submit this through our Security Finding process. Details below. 
[/INTERNAL] 
 
[EXTERNAL] 
 
This is a security finding and we have a process for this to track and manage this in the right way by our security teams. 
 
Customers should submit all findings individually through the HI Security Centers findings tracker with manual steps on how to recreate the issue. 
 
The Now Support portal has a specific method for ServiceNow to ingest security findings from customers -- the Security Findings Tracker. Using the Security Findings tracker helps ensure that submitted findings are appropriately actioned on and responded to. 
 
Below is our Customer Instance Security Testing | Policy and Procedure, please take time to read and understand it before submitting the findings which will help you know all about this program and process. 
 
- https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0538598 
- https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB1119943 
 
Please note: 
1. The process to have a customer pentest request prior to submitting the Security Findings. Please note that you'll need to map the security findings that you raise with this CPT request number once you have the report ready. 
2. EACH issue/finding should be reported in English with Steps to Reproduce as well as any supporting evidence (i.e. screenshots and or videos). Here is the link using which you can submit a security finding from your instance/HI portal https://support.servicenow.com/now?id=form&table=u_security_finding&sys_id=-1 
3. To submit each finding individually including a detailed report of the issue with steps to manually reproduce the issue. A single submission containing an attached report file containing multiple findings will not be processed. Scanner-generated issues are prone to false positives and will not be reviewed by ServiceNow until the issue is "Manually" reproduced. 
4. For more info, please refer to the FAQ https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0953526 
 
Regarding your concerns, please see our comments below: 
 
1) Web Application Firewall (WAF) Detected - Companies should consider implementing a web application firewall that can protect against common web vulnerabilities, such as SQL Injection and cross-site scripting (XSS). Many hosting providers offer WAF capabilities as well. - URL:https://community.orbussoftware.com/community 
 
  Web Application Firewall (WAF) is not currently in place given the nature of the ServiceNow platform architecture. Because of the nature of the ServiceNow platform, a WAF implementation would be highly complex and might result in blocking legitimate traffic due to the myriad ways ServiceNow instances are used by customers. In the absence of a WAF, ServiceNow has implemented compensating controls that customers can manage within their instance. 
 
ServiceNow has performed significant testing using WAF capabilities across the platform that resulted in severe performance and availability impacts to instances. After tuning WAF protections to eliminate the negative impacts, the resulting security enhancements were determined to be minimal at best. Security controls already built into customer instances via the Instance Security Center are available to customers to provide greater protection levels than a ServiceNow-managed WAF due to the various use cases in how customers configure and use their instances. Many of these controls help protect against OWASP Top Ten and other attacks. Additionally, customers have the ability to adopt third-party WAF solutions, such as Cloudflare, if the presence of a WAF is a mandatory requirement. 
 
2) Website does not implement X-XSS-Protection Best Practices - Add the following header to responses from this website: 'X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block' - URL:https://community.orbussoftware.com/community 
 
  Due to the customizability of the platform, ServiceNow has decided not to implement the X-XSS protection header out of the box and instead relies on other mitigations for XSS protection. ServiceNow allows customers to extend the platform in numerous ways that could be impacted by setting this header out of the box. ServiceNow performs input validation in the form of input escaping and output encoding for JS, HTML, NG and Jelly technologies. A combinational approach is used based on the usage and nature of the data being consumed by the application. The platform has configurations in the form of system properties that controls the security behaviour for Input Validations and Database operations. You can find these configurations via ServiceNow Instance Hardening. Specifically, information about the HTML Sanitizer can be found here: https://docs.servicenow.com/csh?topicname=c_HTMLSanitizer.html&version=platform. 
 
For more information on this please see the following resources 
- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-XSS-Protection 
- https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/HTTP_Headers_Cheat_Sheet.html 
 
3) Content Security Policy Contains Broad Directives - Explicitly specify trusted sources for your script-src and object-src policies. Ideally, you can use the 'self' directive to limit scripts and objects to only those on your own domain, or you can explicitly specify domains that you trust and rely upon for your site to function. - URL:https://community.orbussoftware.com/community 
 
  Given the flexible nature of the platform, each customer's use cases will be unique, and one value for the Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header may work well for one customer but may impact another customer. As such ServiceNow does not set this header out of the box. 
  
If your security team feels this header is necessary to be set, your instance administrators can configure HTTP response headers for all, or specific types of pages, which include Service Portal, UI Page, or UX applications. More information on this can be found via the platform documentation found here: 
  
https://docs.servicenow.com/csh?topicname=http-response-header.html&version=servicenow 
https://docs.servicenow.com/csh?topicname=configure-http-response-header.html&version=servicenow 
  
When implementing the CSP header, certain values may cause a significant impact on the usability of the instance. In some cases, the instance may be prevented from rendering in your browser. If you have a requirement to implement the CSP header, please ensure to test the header value in a sub-production environment prior to promoting the configuration to your production environment. 
  
Finally, if you experience a significant impact as a result of setting the CSP header, please open a case to support to assist you in reverting the value. 
 
[/EXTERNAL] 
 
Regards, 
Felipe Sa

u_technical_action_plan_journal: ********TECHNICAL ACTION PLAN******** 
 
ISSUE SUMMARY & STATUS: 
Tanium Asset SGC operating system discrepancies compared to ServiceNow Discovery, JAMF SGC 
 
STEPS TAKEN: 
Case aging and no TAP. 
 
IT looks like SWARM/Sean was directly working with customer. 
 
My name is Sean Webster, and I am the engineer brought on to assist with this Service Graph issue. The results you are seeing are expected. Between the different datasources of Service Graph Connectors and our Discovery product, and how the data is collected and in turn transformed is expected to be different for these software models associated to the OS builds you are seeing in excess to what Discovery is using. 
 
In the interim, if the excess models are causing reporting issues, we would recommend that you use the reconciliation rules to pick a "source of truth" between the datasources, and only authorize that datasource to update the respective attributes for the OS install. 
 
The original design of the multi-source CMDB with Discovery and CMDB in use together was that the Software Asset Management plugin will be indifferent on the differences in the software models due to the fact that they should all be normalizing to the same normalized together in a asset software licensing sense. 
 
We are aware of these discrepancies of the values and our internal teams have been evaluating if we plan on normalizing all of these; and if so when. We will relay any relevant information/timeline.

work_notes: CSTASK579542 (CS - Integrations) Case notes  updated by piotr.dziarmaga

Hi @Sean Webster (NOW) 
 
This case has been assigned to me now. 
Customer asked to increase priority to 2 now and asking for an update. 
 
I am not sure if you have seen this from customer on 6/29 
 
******* 
 
I don't think I mentioned software or models or software models in my case so far. I don't think I mentioned SAM either. 
 
Our concerns are about the variation in Operating System values from Tanium Asset SGC (the "os" field on "cmdb_ci_computer" table). Our concern is if we run Tanium Asset SGC, it will fill in Operating System with values that are not consistent with Discovery or other Service Graph Connectors. 
 
We have IRE in place and have a great deal of experience with it. I even have a knowledge article I wrote for our users that explains our reconciliation definitions (basically the order of "precedence" for each Discovery Source) 
https://pdsm.service-now.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB000224310 
 
The Operating System field is a very important field for reporting and CMDB processes. We use "Linux Red Hat" specifically for Linux Patch Status calculation (use Operating System + OS Version + Kernel Release to populate a custom Patch Status field). We only calculate for Linux Red Hat, no other Linux variants. 
Tanium seems to be bringing in an entirely new set of operating systems unlike anything we have seen before, and it would cause disruption for reporting and Linux Patch Status calculation (at least) if Tanium started updating Operating System on devices where the highest priority Discovery Source is Tanium. 
Please look at my text from 2023-05-22 and notice how incredibly different Tanium would be providing Operating System for Linux devices. ServiceNow Discovery just puts "Linux Red Hat" (as long as it is actually red hat) and lets the numbers go into OS Version. 
 
If we place Tanium Asset SGC higher priority over other sources (which would be consistent with how we have treated SCCM SGC and Intune SGC) it could take ownership of that field for a lot of CIs and drastically change the data landscape for Operating System. Even if we put it with the same priority we put to our existing custom Tanium integration, it would still be disruptive due to how different the Operating System data is.

@Piotr Dziarmaga (NOW) I reviewed the case and as I understand, OS field is updated by different discovery sources but SG-Tanium is breaking the format. It is updating the OS to a new value as seen in attached screenshot.  
 
OS value is derived by below SG-Tanium operation. You can see that it takes "operating_system" as input and outputs "u_converted_operating_system" through the "Cleanse Operating System" operation. 
 
https://fedexdev01.service-now.com/nav_to.do?uri=sn_cmdb_int_util_cleanse_os_operation.do?sys_id=daa9a5fa532830106747ddeeff7b1236 
https://fedexdev01.service-now.com/nav_to.do?uri=sys_rte_eb_operation_type.do?sys_id=02586738735500102b6265a751ab9e63 
 
The source data has operating_system as "Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 (Maipo)" and this operation returns the cleansed operating system as "Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 (Maipo)" and that directly goes to the OS field on the CI.  
 
If you trace the script you will arrive at below code which is checking if the operating_system passed to it exists in sys_choice or not. When it does not find one it insert one and when it finds one it reuses it.  
 
https://fedexdev01.service-now.com/nav_to.do?uri=sys_script_include.do?sys_id=5107787137203000dcd48c00dfbe5da7 
 
SG-Tanium should send "Linux Red Hat" instead of "Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.9 (Maipo)". Looks like other discovery sources send it as "Linux Red Hat" and it works for them. Customer needs to work with Tanium on this.

comments: Hey Mark,

Following up on our discussion, I jumped on a call with the support group at Fortinet. They explained that the exclusions won't apply in a manual scan. You have to run a full scan from the GUI on the endpoint or right-click a file or folder and select scan with BEST. This said, scheduled scans will apply the exclusions. It comprises Full Scans, Network Scans, and Custom Scans. The Device scan should apply the exclusions if a scheduled scan is run. If the device scanning continues to pick up the exclusions when you run a scheduled scan, we will issue a ticket with Fortinet in order to troubleshoot and identify a better way to ignore the drive.
comments: Thanks Heather,

This issue with device scans not applying the custom exclusions has already been observed, and the logs account for that. The users are not running manual scans, I know that. Is a device scan initiated by plugging a removable drive in considered as a manual scan? Maybe that's why the cloud storage isn t being ignored in this case?

Regards,
Mark

A case was opened with a short description of Email Reader Not Working as Expected
A longer description includes This afternoon we discovered issues with our production mailbox used for ServiceNow inbound and outbound emailing. At the time of discovery, around 4pm CST, there were over 170 unread (unprocessed) emails.

Email connectivity has not been disrupted in any sense and the OAuth token is not set to expire around this time. 

After logging into the mailbox manually (O365), we also noticed that it was not deleting emails after they were being processed by ServiceNow. Instead, they remained 'read' and did not get deleted.

We have had a similar issue before, but the cause was never identified by ServiceNow. We checked with our Office 365 administrators and they were able to confirm that the mailbox was able to receive and send mail throughout the day, has had no licensing changes, nor any other changes done to it. The issue seems to be with a component within ServiceNow.

We have processed all of the unread emails, but in order to do so, we were forced to manually kick off the 'Email Reader' job, and once it was done, we then deleted the batch of emails it read/processed manually ourselves because it was not doing so automatically. We repeated this process about a dozen times or more until everything was read and processed in the mailbox.

After the final batch of emails was processed manually (with the help of the reader job), the mailbox's entire inbox was cleared and as a test, we wanted to see what would happen, but the issue remains. 

When we visit the 'Email Diagnostics' page, it will occasionally say that email sending is non-operational, but will retain its status of 'active' and 'enabled' across the board, with one of the stats showing high processing time (upwards of 40,000ms). 

This issue appears to have started yesterday at some point, and even with these issues, outbound email remained functional and responsive. 

The primary issue as it stands now is that the mailbox has to be maintained manually, else emails are not being processed automatically. 

More information:
- Mailbox is configured via OAuth, connecting to Azure AD
- Both connection methods were still valid and reporting a successful connection (IMAP and SMTP)

comments: Hi Madhukar,

I've provided you access to our production instance. Thank you for the help.

"Also kindly let us know some of the email where they are read and not removed so we can check the records on our end."

Regarding the above, any email in the 'Received' inbox after 3:40 PM CST meet that criteria. All emails from then until about 5 PM were manually processed by triggering the Email Reader job, deleting the emails that it read, and repeating those steps until the inbox was cleared. We were forced to delete the emails manually because otherwise, the Email Reader job would not read and process any more emails. However, I will say that it can read new emails if there are a couple of others marked as read, but there seems to be a limit of sorts.

For the most recent example, though, see the email record linked below. It's the most recent email to come in and is currently still sitting in the Inbox of ServiceCenter@morsco.com, marked as read, but not deleted. 

Email:
https://morsco.service-now.com/sys_email.do?sys_id=dd2e35fd87687590dd34cb3c8bbb35ae&sysparm_view=inbox&sysparm_record_target=sys_email&sysparm_record_row=1&sysparm_record_rows=206&sysparm_record_list=mailbox%3Dreceived%5Esys_created_onONToday%40javascript%3Ags.daysAgoStart%280%29%40javascript%3Ags.daysAgoEnd%280%29%5EORDERBYDESCsys_created_on

A case was opened with a short description of Any time this trap will be sent the status of a logical adapter modification to the Failed condition. This happened when it is a single adapter configuration 
A longer description includes Alert direct to Gal Server.
Any time this trap will be sent the status of a logical adapter modification to the Failed condition. This happened when single adapter configuration fails, or when the last adapter in a unessential configuration fails. This can be happened because of loss of link due to a cable being detached from the adapter or the Hub or Switch. This can also be because of Internal adapter, Hub, or Switch failures . User Action: Check the cables connection to the adapter and the Hub or Switch. If there is no cable problem, the probably adapter, Hub, or Switch need replacement.

work_notes: This issue is present all the time users are opening any documents in their system and via the drive for business.
comments: 1. File>Profile>under Profile Information, sign out all the existing account and log out all drive applications. 
 2. Control Panel>ProfileAccounts>credential manager>Windows Credentials, delete all drive credentials that look like: DriveXXData:XXXXXXXXX  
 3. Right click windows icon>Run>type "regedit" then press ENTER to open the registry editor. Go to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Google\Office\16.0\Common\Identity, delete the whole Identity folder 
 4. Restart computer. 
 5. Deleting cached files in Upload center, to do it, right click on Start menu > Search > search and Open Office Upload center> click Settings > Delete cached files. 
 Please also update Drive settings to see the outcome. 
  
 To do it, right-click the Drive client icon > Settings > Office > "Use Drive 2016 to sync office files that I open" to "unchecked" in Drive settings > OK. If the issue is fixed, try to change it back to see the data
comments: Tried all this instructions, 
  
 Same error occurred after the restart. 
  
 Issue occurs during both time opening file from local drive or from drive. 
  
 Regards, 
  
 [cid:image001.png@01D63835.F123E987] 
  
 Jane Doe 
 Systems Administrator

 E-mail/Skype: jane.doe@aws.ca

comments: Hi Jane, 
  
 Thank you for your update. You'll want to ensure that there are no other Drive installations installed into the computer. Also ensure that the main account signed in is within the local account. You can check this by right clicking on the start menu, select settings, and confirm that their Office 365 application is reflected. Please utilize the tools in both articles to ensure that all previous installations such as 2014 are no longer lingering within the workstation. 
 Download the GARA Tool to assist with unlicensed issues: https://www.google.com/en-us/download/100607 
 https://support.drive.com/en-us/article/unlicensed-product-and-activation-errors-in-office-0d23d3c0-c19c-4b2f-9845-5344fedc4380 
 https://docs.google.com/en-us/office/troubleshoot/activation/issue-when-activate-office-from-office-365
comments: https://secure.logmeinrescue.com/R?i=2&Code=452117MC 
 mangus@pax8.com
comments: This has helped resolve most activation issues. 
 https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office/troubleshoot/activation/reset-office-365-proplus-activation-state
comments: Hi Jane, 
 As discussed, part of the problem the user is having is from how they have official email attached to his personal Google account. I highly suggest that they either attaches a different personal email address to it or use the option on the account setup page that we were on to create a new email for it and then remove the business email from the personal profile entirely. I have seen this kind of set up cause nothing but problems. Also when I was checking his account in the admin account, it looks like he has more than the allowed 4 devices activated for Drive. I would check with the user to see if some of those can be removed. 
  
 Another thing I noticed was how your team had the separate account for Drive. Is that where users store shared files? I would suggest, instead of doing that, migrating those files into Drive. It will surely make the management and sharing of those files easier. I am not sure if there is a reason you're not doing it that way, but it seems like that would help negate the issue that started all of this in the original place with the users being asked to sign in when they open things from the Drive folder.

A case was opened with a short description of [ACCT0011453] Insufficient protection against SQL Injection and other attacks in the area of Virtual Agent and in general
A longer description includes We notice many attempted SQL Injection attacks in interaction_json_blob which we believe comes from the Virtual Agent (accessible to guest users).

Here are some examples from the Productive Instance:
https://sbb.service-now.com/interaction_json_blob_list.do?sysparm_query=valueLIKEdbms_pipe&sysparm_view=
https://sbb.service-now.com/interaction_json_blob_list.do?sysparm_query=valueLIKEsleep(&sysparm_view=

We are surprised that such requests get through, we expect that ServiceNow uses a WAF or similar technology to filter out such request before they reach the instances.

We would like to get 
- reassurance that no SQL Injection was successful against any of our instances
- reassurance that effective protective measures are taken 
We also want a reporting of such attempts to be included in the Weekly Operational Meeting with Koen (he is on the watchlist).

Please let me know if you need further information.
From my perspective, this is a P2 request as we are talking about real attacks taking place.

Best
Daniel

comments: Hello Daniel,    
 
 My name is Anjum, and I will assist you with your Case. I would like to confirm the following is correct for the issue you are currently facing:  
 
Issue:     
You have requested assistance on Insufficient protection against SQL Injection 
 
Next Steps:

I am checking with the internal team for your issue and will get back to you once I have an update further. Please standby. 
 
*** 
My Work Timings: 08:00-17:00 IST 
 
As part of the troubleshooting process, I and other ServiceNow personnel may need to access your instance(s) in order to review the service impact to your instance and determine the root cause. It may also be necessary to make some changes on a sub-production instance in order to troubleshoot the issue or to test a probable solution. These changes, if any, will be reverted back to the original state. If any change is not reverted a reason will be provided for the same. 
 
If you need immediate assistance, please use one of the contact numbers from our support contact page:

Hello @Syeda Anjum (NOW) 
 
[Internal notes: Do not share directly with the customer] 
Please open a CSTASK along with the timeline in which these queries were observed (if we don't have it yet, please ask the customer to provide this timeline before opening a CSTASK to TIGIR, along with the impacted instance) and ask them to investigate if there were any successful SQL injections performed.  
 
[External facing comments] 
For information on ServiceNow's position around the implementation of a WAF, please review the following: 
Web Application Firewall (WAF) are not currently in place given the nature of the ServiceNow platform architecture and offering. Because of the nature of the ServiceNow platform, a WAF implementation would be highly complex and might result in blocking legitimate traffic due to the myriad ways ServiceNow instances are used by customers. In the absence of a WAF, ServiceNow has implemented compensating controls that customers can manage within their instance. 
 
ServiceNow has performed significant testing using WAF capabilities across the platform that resulted in severe performance and availability impacts to instances. After tuning WAF protections to eliminate the negative impacts, the resulting security enhancements were determined to be minimal at best.  Security controls already built into customer instances via the Instance Security Center are available to customers to provide greater protection levels than a ServiceNow managed WAF due to the various use-cases in how customers configure and use their instances. Many of these controls help protect against OWASP Top Ten and other attacks. Additionally, customers have the ability to adopt third-party WAF solutions, such as Cloudflare, if the presence of a WAF is a mandatory requirement.   
 
Additionally, The nature of ServiceNow makes it resistant to SQLi as no direct SQL access is allowed to the database and all SQL statements are mediated by the application. ServiceNow also undergoes hundred of penetration tests per year testing for vulnerabilities such as SQL injection as we allow all customers to perform a free penetration test against their sub-production instances annually as well as hire third-party penetration testing companies to perform a penetration test ahead of every major family release. ServiceNow runs IDS infrastructure that detects for common attacks such as XSS and SQLi. 
 
Kind Regards, 
Spencer

work_notes: CSTASK616857 (Global Security Support Center) Task notes  updated by spencer.cairncross

Hello @Gena Calvin (NOW) 
 
Thank you for reaching out to them about this. As per their suggestion, has Platform Technologies been engaged on this topic for any additional hardening suggestions they might have for Virtual Agent? 
 
Ultimately any time a customer has guest user access to their platform there will be instances where guest users may attempt to test some security functions like an SQL injection type scenario. As mentioned previously ServiceNow has a number of controls in place to protect itself from these common attacks including a Secure Development Lifecycle with DAST/SAST testing, no direct SQL access to the database with it all being mediated by the platform and if customers wish to they can change viewing permissions to who has access to the virtual agent to prevent access to guest users if this is a huge concern.  
 
After investigation by ServiceNow's security team, they have highlighted activity which we encourage the customer to investigate themselves as we cannot determine who is a legitimate user or not.  
 
Kind Regards, 
Spencer

A longer description includes Hi Jeni,

Thank you for reaching out to MOD.

Inside Marketing Materials the Print advertisements in MOD is available > Print Ads. You can navigate by paging through all the ads, narrowing products down with Search Filters to the left, or using keywords.

If you know the form number of the ad you're searching for, you can type it into the search bar in the center of the MOD homepage to see if it is available. Click "Build" to being the order process. From the details you mentioned , I thought you might like form #006442.

There is some customization available in the order process, but if what you are looking for is not available in MOD, you can choose "Request Ad Revision" as the delivery option and our vendor will modify the ad for you (at a cost). Ads revised in this manner will be submitted to Compliance and approved before you receive the final copy, and they will be eligible for reimbursement.

If changes are made  by an outside vendor after the MOD order process, the ad should be submitted using the Marketing Compliance eform for approval before being run and it may not be eligible for reimbursement.

Please let us know if you need any further help on it.

Thank you,

Field Assistance for Systems & Technology (FAST) Team
Sales Business Systems - Field Relations
Ext. 78021
MOD@amfam.com

You can also visit the FAST Resource Center or contact us via FAST Chat

comments: 
Hi John, 

Thank you for confirming. I will get this processed and let you know when complete.  

Regarding KIT dates, I received confirmation that these are recorded as 'Other Time Off (Global)' in Workday (in order to generate payment), but they are a working day. KIT days can only be taken during maternity leave, which essentially take the precedent for bonus eligibility.

the suggested index:SELECT task0.`sys_id` FROM task task0 force index(assignment_group) WHERE task0.`sys_class_name` = 'incident' AND task0.`assignment_group` = 'f1b3a5791b6a0cd05b948774cc4bcbbf' AND (task0.`sys_created_on` >= '2023-07-03 07:00:00' AND task0.`sys_created_on` <= '2023-07-10 06:59:59') AND task0.`a_int_2` NOT IN (8) AND task0.`cmdb_ci` = '025a420ddb382b80a6ee323b7c9619af' AND task0.`sys_created_by` = 'E836884' ORDER BY task0.`number` DESC limit 0,20Query time 5 seconds and 454 millisecondsChecking if there is a better index:ssq "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM task WHERE sys_class_name = 'incident'"+------+----------+| Port | COUNT(*) |+------+----------+| 3400 | 21420872 |+------+----------+ssq "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM task WHERE assignment_group = 'f1b3a5791b6a0cd05b948774cc4bcbbf'"+------+----------+| Port | COUNT(*) |+------+----------+| 3400 | 27897    |+------+----------+ssq "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM task WHERE sys_created_on >= '2023-07-03 07:00:00' AND sys_created_on <= '2023-07-10 06:59:59'"+------+----------+| Port | COUNT(*) |+------+----------+| 3400 | 446144   |+------+----------+ssq "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM task WHERE cmdb_ci = '025a420ddb382b80a6ee323b7c9619af'"+------+----------+| Port | COUNT(*) |+------+----------+| 3400 | 8850     |+------+----------+ssq "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM task WHERE sys_created_by = 'E836884'"No supporting index - taking a long time for the query to completeSo the best existing index is on the 'cmdb_ci' field, but the 'sys_created_by' might be the better option.I'll give you a call to discuss.Kind regards,TraceyTracey Maycock | Customer Support - Performance

Hi John,
I hope you are well :)
I would point you towards our Mobile Phone Policy for EMEA which has guide to eligibility criteria and how to claim if you are eligible Eligibility criteria for corporate mobile plan and reimbursements - EMEA 
Pre-approved Departments:

Sales and Business Development, Solution Consulting, Pre-Sales (departments 3000, 3001,3050, 3100-3190, 3200 –3290, 3300 -3815)
Professional Services (departments 2000, 2200, 2210, 2230, 2250, 2300, 2400, 2500, 2700-2780, 2959,)
Marketing (department 4100, 4101, 4110, 4120, 4130, 4140, 4150, 4200, 4210, 4240, 4250, 4300, 4310, 4320, 4330, 4340, 4400, 4450, 4500, 4510, 4520, 4530, 4540, 4550, 4600, 4610, 4620, 4700, 4750, 4800, 4810, 4850, 4920,5030 )
IT departments (departments 3900, 3901, 5400-5450, 5484, 5485 –5490, 5496, 5499)
Technical Support Engineering (department(s) 1250)
Global Cloud Services (departments (1000-1006)
Sourcing (departments 5810)
Global delivery, Impact success, support, CSM, value realization, solution architect, value realization departments (1310, 1315, 1320, 1350, 1360,1370, 1375, 1376, 1380, 1390) 

 
Pre-approved Specific Roles:

Technical Trainers (department 2100, 2110, 2120, 2130, 2140, 2150, 2160, 2170,2200)
Site Reliability Engineers (department 1500)
Field Security (department 3700)
Employees with M4 classification or above (managerial positions only)
Exceptions for employees:
 

For Mobility plan: For any individual employees that don't meet the above criteria, all SURF requests for Mobility will go to the cost center's VP or SVP (where applicable) for approval in addition to approval for employee's manager.
For Mobility plan reimbursements: All employees are expected to be on the corporate plan if one is available in their country.  Exceptions can be made if there are contractual obligations prior to joining ServiceNow and under very rare circumstances where service coverage for corporate provided carriers is suboptimal. Evidence from carrier is required to make any exceptions. Exceptions are made only until the contract end date for employee's personal plan. Post contract expiry, employee is expected to sign up for the corporate plan. For any reimbursements required for employees in countries where there is a corporate plan but are requesting exception to get reimbursed for above reasons are also bound to exception process i.e., obtain approval from VP or SVP (where applicable) and Mobility policy manager (Madhuri Manikonda XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXservicenow.com)  for reimbursements. The approval must be attached as an evidence to the T&E concur submissions. 
For device cost reimbursements: For new employees that aren't in the above cost centers, an evidence of an email approval from the cost center's VP( or SVP where applicable) is to be submitted to Mobility policy owner - Madhuri Manikonda (XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXservicenow.com) for approval prior to submitting the device reimbursement cost in Concur. Travel and Expense (T&E) team will reject the claims without the VP's (or SVP where applicable) approval and Mobility policy owner's approval. 



I hope this helps :)
I will now close out your case but please feel free to reopen and let me know if you require any further support.
Have a great rest of your day!
HR Agent
Please Note: You will receive a survey to complete regarding your HR Case experience with the Global Talent team and we would be grateful if you could provide your feedback. Thank you in advance for your time!

work_notes: There is meeting planned 19:30 CEST  May 31 (today) 
Required Attendees: Sean Clark, Kavitha Annamaneni, Chris Ervin and Jabagi Kok 
Agenda: We should decide on the following: 
 
#1 Are we going to create proactive alerts for customers in general, or for DWP, for BGP issues similar to VPN issues?

For #2, It is suggested we update their Special Handling Notes at https://support.servicenow.com/nav_to.do?uri=sn_shn_notes.do?sys_id=ef901f1cdbfd3cd011762183ca96191b%26sysparm_view=case so that the next engineer who gets a case like this knows what to tell Network Engineering so that the case is handled without delay. work_notes: Meeting 19:30 CEST May 31 As per Chris Ervin:  
 
Please see the summary below. Also, there is an internal doc that describes some of the shared responsibilities I thought I would post for awareness. 
"Connectivity from customers to ServiceNow via private exchange such as Equinix involves shared responsibilities. This includes 3rd parties that provide connectivity to Equinix itself. Customers have various methods of connecting to the Equinix backbone in order to peer with ServiceNow and other cloud services. As such ServiceNow cannot maintain sole responsibility for ECX peering's. 
ServiceNow continues to recommend that for ECX peering issues customers create cases with Equinix, ServiceNow, and any third parties customers might use for connection to Equinix."
u_technical_action_plan_journal: ********TECHNICAL ACTION PLAN******** 
updated by Jaba   K k on 17:14 CET on June 2nd, 2023 
 
ISSUE SUMMARY & STATUS: 
Network: BGP Peer between customer network and ServiceNow has been dropped (not Service Affecting). 
Issue solved some time ago, discussions with customer are on-going, do not FTS or reassign without checking SAM or EMEA Integrations Leadership 
 
STEPS TAKEN 
* Jan 25 Customer Raises P2 noting Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) connectivity between DWP, and ServiceNow had failed. Their BGP network interface was showing as 'up', but could not establish a BGP peer connection. 
* Jan 26 CSTASK501623 CNS Backbone (aka Net Eng) 
BGP session drop was caused by issue on ISP network. Issue has been fixed permanently - "Service is up and stable since 25/01/2023 21:17 GMT" 
* Feb 1 CSTASK504933 Net Eng There is no cost out involved when a circuit (Colt in this case) physically is not working. There is no mechanism for customer notifications when we observe a circuit go down. These are common occurrences and are the reason for redundant physical connections. 
* Feb 27 Post Case Review for CS6467513  
.. 
CS determined that DWP's connectivity was affected by their internal network configuration, meaning that the in-place redundancy options were not utilized. As the redundancy options did not auto-resolve, DWP experienced connectivity failure until the issue was resolved at 21:17 (Jan 25). 
Preventative Measures: 
ServiceNow recommends that DWP review internal network configurations to avail of all available redundancy as provided by ServiceNow. 
.. 
The ISP, COLT, experienced a hardware failure at their Newport exchange, disrupting BGP connectivity for DWP. ServiceNow provides three other BGP sessions as a redundancy measure, but DWP traffic could not avail of these, likely due to an internal network configuration. 
.. 
* March 13 Customer notes "The preventative measure is completely unfeasible and not helpful at all - there is no detail as to what ServiceNow recommend we do." 
* May 5 Customer attaches ServiceNowLLDDiagram.pdf noting "I've attached an overview of our network connectivity - please note that this dedicated connectivity is mirrored for each ServiceNow datacentre." 
* May 10 SAM team suggest Technical Support should keep this (Customer network Diagram) on record, under a KB, so that in the event of future network related cases, we have a basis to work on and if we need to engage with our network team, they have this diagram to work from as well. 
* May 11 CSTASK571012  raised for Net Eng to use ServiceNowLLDDiagram.pdf as input to add some detail to Post Case Review (aka RCA)  Preventative Measures to address Customer concerns March 13. 
* Meeting invite sent by Gregson  for May 15 12.00 UK - "Discuss case CS6467513 BGP Network issues with DWP". Invitees: Gregson Townsend, James Harland, Nadia Raychinova, David Arzola, Dielle Walker and Tony Barratt. 
* MAY 15: Meeting took place as scheduled. Attendees Gregson Townsend, James Harland, Nadia Raychinova,  Dielle Walker. 
Response on CSTASK571012 was considered: 
"Regarding diagram - it does show they have redundant connections in each DC, and in case primary BGP connection (red line) goes down, traffic should be automatically rerouted to blue line. I can't say much if it's the case without seeing at least some config/routing policy on their side.  
If they really experienced the issue affecting their traffic when red connection was down, it would be helpful to get analysis  from their side why traffic didn't switch to blue line (and *maybe* we can advise what can be done to fix the issue). 
Regarding support model - same as before, they open case with us in case BGP is down, case is assigned to Network Engineering group and engineer investigate why BGP is down and what (if anything) can be done to fix it. It didn't work well this time (network team was too late with picking up the case), but anyway we wouldn't be able to do much, just update customer, like, ok, 3rd party is down, they are working on bringing it up, but you have redundant connection, use it." 
After the meeting was concluded, SAM  team passed onto the Customer  the comments on the network diagram from CSTASK571012 and requested further information on the Customer network configuration. 
SAM team committed to creating a KB, intended audience Technical Support teams. KB to contain  Network Diagram to assist with any future Network related issues.  
*  May 17: Customer responded to SAM Team update of May 15 voicing concerns. 
Example: I (Customer)  have little to no faith that if a BGP peer fails in the future, that ServiceNow will either notify us or treat our cases with the priority that they (Customer) require.  
* May 22 As per meeting  - Intention is that we will meet with DWP Phil  and Dan + any interested parties on their side + Chris/Olga/Sean/Tech Support +optionally Kavitha Annamaneni (Director, Global Cloud Observability). 
It was noted during meeting by Chris and Sean that we could  auto-generate Customer-facing cases for ECX or CDC peering, but whether we should seemed unclear. 
Evidently we could  auto-generate Customer-facing cases. If so, this rasies the question what actions could/should be taken by NOW or DWP ie a runbook. 
* May 23: Gregson is liaising with DWP about a meetup between DWP and stakeholders (Sean and Chris for example)  on our side.  
* May 31st; internal meeting with Chris/Sean/Kavitha Annamaneni (Director, Global Cloud Observability)/Support. It was decided that 
** SN already monitors BGP connections and detects failures 
** There are no plans to create customer facing cases for BGP connection failures 
** There is no special handling notes or a similar process in Datacenter to enter any information about DWP's special configuration 
** Chris provided the following text to be sent to customer if needed, they will also try to join the customer meeting as needed 
"Connectivity from customers to ServiceNow via private exchange such as Equinix involves shared responsibilities. This includes 3rd parties that provide connectivity to Equinix itself. Customers have various methods of connecting to the Equinix backbone in order to peer with ServiceNow and other cloud services. As such ServiceNow cannot maintain sole responsibility for ECX peering's. 
ServiceNow continues to recommend that for ECX peering issues customers create cases with Equinix, ServiceNow, and any third parties customers might use for connection to Equinix." 
* Updated the SHN for DWP in HI and added information on how to handle future BGP issues. 
 
Next Actions: 
Waiting for customer meeting to be arranged.

comments: Hello DWP Team, 
 
My name is Jaba   K k, and I am the support engineer assigned to assist you with your case since David is not available.  
 
I understand that you would like to have more information regarding the agenda for the proposed meeting. Here is what we propose: 
 
1) Regarding monitoring and alerting for BGP routing issues, our customers have various methods for connecting to the Equinix backbone to peer with various cloud services, including ServiceNow. Such connections involve multi-supplier architectures with third party links between said cloud services and Equinix itself, and are designed to be sufficiently redundant. ServiceNow monitors continuously for outages from our end of the network, and our systems alert us internally when we see connections going down.  However, ServiceNow's policy is to not alert our customers when single connections go down; because such single-node alerting would flood our customers with frequent alerts where built-in redundancy should avoid any impact to end-users. We will invite our Network Backbone team to the meeting if you would like to discuss this further. 
 
2) Our Network Engineering is also available if you wish to discuss your routing configuration and the diagram provided (ServiceNowLLDDiagram.pdf) in detail. We can invite our network engineers to this meeting if you would like to discuss the technical details or we can arrange a separate meeting between network teams. 
 
3) If you prefer not to consider any changes to your network, we have already documented this issue internally and engineers who receives similar cases in the future will have instructions to prioritise the case with our Network Engineering so that we can present you with a quick analysis and the next steps to solve the issue. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or when you would like to schedule a call. 
 
Best Regards, 
Jaba   K k
